Questions.QuestionString: Features of PW1100G-JM engine are:
Answers: Axial flow, twin spool turbofan with an ultra-high bypass ratio, low speed gear-driven fan
Axial flow, twin spool turbofan with an ultra-high bypass ratio, high speed gear-driven fan
Axial flow, twin spool turbofan with a low bypass ratio, low speed gear-driven fan

Questions.QuestionString: “PW1130G-JM” means:
Answers: Engine is rated at max thrust of 25300 lbs to install in the Airbus A/C
Engine is rated at max thrust of 30000 lbs to install in the Airbus A/C
Engine is rated at max thrust of 25000 lbs to install in the Airbus A/C

Questions.QuestionString: Fan cowls:
Answers: Each of the 3 fan cowl door latches has a fan cowl door proximity sensor which is able to detect whether the relative latch is locked to alert the ground crew to the fan cowl’s position
Fan cowl door has two fan cowl door proximity sensors which are able to detect whether the relative latch is locked to alert the ground crew to the fan cowl’s position
Fan cowl door has a fan cowl door proximity sensor which is able to detect whether the relative latch is locked to alert the ground crew to the fan cowl’s position

Questions.QuestionString: Engine mounts have:
Answers: The FWD mount assy is attached to the CIC, supports side and vertical loads and the AFT mount assy is attached to the TEC, reacts to engine fore-aft, side, vertical, roll loads
The FWD mount assy is attached to the TEC, supports side and vertical loads and the AFT mount assy is attached to the CIC, reacts to engine fore-aft, side, vertical, roll loads
The FWD mount assy is attached to the CICF, supports side and vertical loads and the AFT mount assy is attached to the TECF, reacts to engine fore-aft, side, vertical, roll loads

Questions.QuestionString: Nacelle system components provide the engine with the capabilities:
Answers: An aerodynamic for engine mounted components
An aerodynamic and protective enclosure for engine mounted components; Collection and discharge of oil, fuel and hydraulic fluid from the engine and its components
An aerodynamic and protective enclosure for engine mounted components; Collection and discharge of oil, fuel from the engine and its components

Questions.QuestionString: The Aft Engine Mount Assy supports:
Answers: The engine fore-aft, side, vertical, and roll loads
The engine vertical, and roll loads
The engine side and vertical loads

Questions.QuestionString: The aerodynamic station 2.5 locates at:
Answers: Outlet of LPC
Outlet of HPC
Outlet of LPT

Questions.QuestionString: To alert the maintenance staff to fan cowl’s not closed position:
Answers: Each fan cowl latch has a proximity switch
The middle fan cowl latch has a proximity switch
Each fan cowl has a proximity switch

Questions.QuestionString: The primary thrust control parameter of the engine PW1100G is:
Answers: N1
N2
EPR

Questions.QuestionString: ENG PW1100G equips with Aircraft Model:
Answers: A321 only
A320 only

Questions.QuestionString: PW1100G highest Thrust could be set up to:
Proximity sensors are installed on each latch of fan cowl doors which sends its position signal to
Answers: the Engine Interface Unit (EIU) & the EEC
the EEC
the Engine Interface Unit (EIU)

Questions.QuestionString: How many Bearing PW1100G has:
How many Bearing Compartment PW1100G has:
The Fan rotor contributes to approximately
Answers: 70% of the thrust
80% of the thrust
90% of the thrust

Questions.QuestionString: How many fan blades are there at the fan rotor?
Each half of C ducts includes one translating sleeve, two actuators,
Answers: ten blocker doors and cascades
five blocker doors and cascades
five blocker doors and pivoting doors

Questions.QuestionString: How many preservation methods are used for the protection of out-of-service engines?
Answers: 3: Preserve the engine for 30 days, or 60 days, or 90 days
2: Preserve the engine for 30 days, or 60 days
2: Preserve the engine for more than 60 days or for 60 days or less

Questions.QuestionString: Each fan cowl door is manually opened, and held open with:
Answers: Two telescopic hold open rods
One telescopic and one fix hold open rods
Two fix hold open rods

Questions.QuestionString: Each thrust reverser cowl door can be opened:
Answers: By hand and held open with two hold open rods
Using the Door Opening System (DOS) by means of hydraulic hand pump and held open by one fix hold open rod
Using the Door Opening System (DOS) by means of hydraulic hand pump and held open by two fix hold open rods

Questions.QuestionString: The Engine Drain System collects and discharges fluids from the engine and pylon through drain outlets located:
Answers: On the sides of the drain mast
On the bottom of the drain mast
On the side and bottom of the drain mast

Questions.QuestionString: For PW 1130 Engine, The ENG Drain mast gives a leak path exit for hydraulic, oil and:
Answers: Fuel component
Reverser system actuators
Permanent Magnet Alternator (PMA)

Questions.QuestionString: The PW1000G engine unique design features:
Answers: An engine fan separated from the low pressure rotor, so that each module operates at optimal speeds
The engine makes use of a number of composite components including a composite fan blade, to achieve a significant weight reduction
The unique debris rejection system provides the best erosion protection, preventing sand, dirt, and other harmful items from reaching the core

Questions.QuestionString: Proximity sensors are installed on each latch of fan cowl doors which sends its position signal to
Answers: The Engine Interface Unit (EIU) & the EEC
The Engine Interface Unit (EIU)

Questions.QuestionString: The inlet cone is made of composite material and is anti-iced with a continuous airflow from
Answers: The HP compressor stage
The 2.5 compressor stage
The ram air inlet

Questions.QuestionString: The FDGS permits the LPC to rotate at a higher speed and
Answers: Helps in reducing the fan rotating speed
Helps in increasing the fan rotating speed
Helps in remaining the fan rotating speed constant

Questions.QuestionString: The forward mount assembly bears
Answers: The engine thrust, vertical and lateral loads
The engine vertical and radial loads
The engine thrust and radial loads

Questions.QuestionString: The fan rotational speeds being lower
Answers: Helps in reducing rotational loads and bird strike fan damage
Helps in increasing rotational loads and bird strike fan damage
Helps in reducing rotational loads

Questions.QuestionString: The geared turbo fan engine reduces the CO2 and NOx emissions and provides improved
Answers: Fuel efficiency and low cost
Fuel efficiency and reduces engine noise
Fuel efficiency and reduces flight range

Questions.QuestionString: Each half of reverser cowl doors:
Answers: Is held closed by 4 latches
Is held open by a hold open rod and an opening actuator
Is held open by two hold open rods

Questions.QuestionString: To open the PW1100G engine’s thrust reverser cowls
Answers: Slats must be fully retracted
Slats must be fully extended
Slats can be at any position

Questions.QuestionString: When opening the engine cowls:
Answers: Respect the wind limitations and the opening/closing sequence
Make sure that the slats are retracted and install a warning notice to prevent slat operation
All above

Questions.QuestionString: Engine drains system provides an aerodynamic drain mast protrudes:
Answers: Exit holes on the sides and bottom surface which are identified to enable troubleshooting
Exit holes on the sides which are identified to enable troubleshooting
Exit holes on the bottom surface which are identified to enable troubleshooting

Questions.QuestionString: Fluids drained from the power plant are?
Answers: Fuel, oil or hydraulic
Fuel, oil or water
Fuel, oil, hydraulic or water

Questions.QuestionString: The forward mount:
Answers: Carries the engine torque, thrust and side loads
Carries the engine torque, vertical and side loads
Carries the engine thrust, vertical and side loads

Questions.QuestionString: The aft mount:
Answers: Carries the engine torque, thrust and side loads
Carries the engine torque, vertical and side loads
Carries the engine thrust, vertical and side loads

Questions.QuestionString: Fluids drained from the pylon are?
Answers: Fuel, oil or hydraulic
Fuel, oil or water
Fuel, hydraulic or water

Questions.QuestionString: The engine is attached to the pylon by
Answers: FWD and AFT mounts
FWD, middle and AFT mounts
Three mounts
